# NoliLab

> NoliLab makes the Loko GPS Tracker — the world's smallest offline GPS device (28.5 × 20.5 × 5.9 mm). It works without cellular networks using LoRa radio technology with up to 20 km range and up to 12 months battery life. No subscription required. Made by Nolilab OÜ, Tallinn, Estonia.

## Main Pages

- [Home](https://nolilab.com/nolilab): Product overview, features, technical specs, pricing, FAQ, and customer stories for the Loko GPS Tracker.
- [Specifications](https://nolilab.com/specifications): Complete technical specifications — dimensions, weight, battery life, GPS/GLONASS/Galileo/BeiDou support, LoRa frequency bands, and connectivity.
- [Software & App](https://nolilab.com/software): Download the Loko GPS tracker app for iOS, Android, and LineageOS. Free configuration tool for macOS, Windows, and Linux.
- [Setup Guides](https://nolilab.com/setup-guides): Step-by-step instructions for configuring Air and Ground units, connecting the mobile app, and starting offline GPS tracking.
- [LoRaWAN](https://nolilab.com/lorawan): Guide to connecting Loko to The Things Network (TTN) for IoT GPS tracking via LoRaWAN gateways.
- [Firmware](https://nolilab.com/firmware): Latest firmware downloads for LoRa P2P and LoRaWAN modes, with upgrade instructions.
- [GPS & LoRa Technology](https://nolilab.com/gps): Educational guide covering GPS technology, LoRa radio, LoRa P2P vs LoRaWAN, radio line of sight, and ionosphere effects on GPS signals.
- [Blog](https://nolilab.com/blog): Articles about Loko GPS tracker, LoRa technology, drone tracking, farm equipment GPS, fleet management, and outdoor adventures.
- [Contact](https://nolilab.com/contact): Support and inquiries — email akio@nolilab.com. Nolilab OÜ, Tallinn, Estonia.
- [Privacy Policy](https://nolilab.com/privacy): Zero data collection policy — all tracking data stays on the user's device with no cloud storage, no accounts, and no tracking cookies.

## Languages

The site is available in English, Japanese (`/ja/`), Spanish (`/es/`), Russian (`/ru/`), French (`/fr/`), and Chinese (`/zh/`).
